title: Kanye West breaks nine month Twitter hiatus to announce Jesus Is King will be released on Friday
text:
Fans have been anticipating his ninth studio album for 13 months.

And no doubt Kanye West diehards are hoping for a miracle later this week.

The 42-year-old rapper broke his nine month Twitter silence early Monday morning to announce his highly-anticipated ninth studio album - titled Jesus Is King - will finally be released on Friday.

Big news: Kanye West (pictured in Kingston, Jamaica on Sunday) broke his nine month Twitter silence early Monday morning to announce his highly-anticipated ninth studio album - titled Jesus Is King - will finally be released on Friday

Risen: Kanye shared an image of a blue vinyl record with the simple caption: '"JESUS IS KING" OCT 25th'

Kanye shared an image of a blue vinyl record with the simple caption: '"JESUS IS KING" OCT 25th'

The tweet on the microblogging site comes over nine months after his last post which came on January 1 earlier this year.

He was acknowledging the criticism he received over his support of US President Donald Trump and wearing the red Make America Great Again hat.

Polarizing: The tweet on the microblogging site comes over nine months after his last post which came on January 1 earlier this year

Eyebrow-raising: He was acknowledging the criticism he received over his support of US President Donald Trump and wearing the red Make America Great Again hat, as he is seen wearing it here during a rant after a Saturday Night Live performance in September 2018

West wrote at the time: 'One of my favorite of many things about what the Trump hat represents to me is that people can’t tell me what to do because I’m black.'

Jesus Is King was originally set to be released on September 27 and fans were left baffled as there was no formal announcement of it's postponement.

The album and tracklist were first announced by his wife Kim Kardashian on Instagram back in August with the original release date.

Jus us: Kanye and wife Kim Kardashian pictured at the Met Gala in New York in May

Announced: Jesus Is King was first announced by Kardashian through Twitter in late August, where she released a photo revealing the track list and release date

The delays are seemingly caused by Kanye's perfectionist tendencies, with sources from his camp told TMZ on September 30 that he keeps making 'final' tweaks, subtly changing the tracks every time he listens to the album.

At the time Kim revealed that he was still working on the final mixes for the project and would instead release it on Sunday after listening sessions, which took place in Detroit, Chicago and New York at the weekend.

She wrote in an Instagram story: 'Kanye is doing a listening session in Chicago tomorrow, then NYC Sunday. He's dropping the album Sunday. Just a few final tweaks to the mixes.'

Sweet: Kim shared this cute picture of Kanye cuddled up with their eldest daughter North last week

Fans have been waiting for over a year for new material, which Kanye began work on in August last year.

Initially the album was named Yandhi and release dates were given for September and November 2018, before it was delayed indefinitely.

The new release date is the same day as the accompanying Jesus Is King documentary which is set for exclusive release in IMAX theaters on Friday.
description: The 42-year-old rapper broke his nine month Twitter silence early Monday morning to announce his highly-anticipated ninth studio album - titled Jesus Is King - will be released Friday.
